column5: WASHINGTON Singapore's Defense Minister Ng Eng Hen on Thursday said his country was seriously considering buying Lockheed Martin Corp's  F-35 fighter jet but was in "no particular hurry" to buy new jets since its F-16 fighters were still in good shape.

column4: Singapore says in 'no particular hurry' to buy Lockheed F-35 jets
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 12 Singapore's Defense Minister Ng Eng Hen on Thursday said his country was seriously considering buying Lockheed Martin Corp's   F-35 fighter jet but was in "no particular hurry" to buy new jets since its F-16 fighters were still in good shape.

column4: FDA panel says Merck's allergy drug effective
column5: A panel of experts advising the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said an oral drug made by Merck & Co was effective in treating grass pollen allergy but expressed concerns about the drug's safety in children.

column4: Norway's $800 bln oil fund buys into MetLife's Boston tower
column5: OSLO  Dec 13 Norway's $800 billion sovereign wealth fund has purhcased a 47.5 percent stake in One Financial Center  a 46-story office tower with 1.3 million rentable square feet in Boston  joining MetLife in the property  it said on Friday.

column4: Asia-Pacific M&A volume falls for 3rd consecutive year  deal size grows
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 13 Asia-Pacific M&A volumes fell 3.3 percent this year  recording the smallest annual tally in four years with stock market volatility hitting the confidence of buyers.

column4: CEE MARKETS 1-MOL lifts Hungarian shares on North Sea acquisition
column5: By Sandor Peto     BUDAPEST  Dec 13 Oil and gas group MOL  led Hungarian stocks higher on Friday after the company firm bought oil and gas projects in the North Sea from BASF. Other Central European equity markets were mixed.     The $375 million North Sea acquisition gives MOL resources in a safe area  something it needs. column4: UPDATE 1-Pretium bulk sample tops gold target by 47 pct
column5: VANCOUVER  Dec 13 Pretium Resources Inc   said on Friday that gold output from a bulk sample program at its flagship Brucejack project in British Columbia topped its target by about 47 percent  sending its shares up as much as 12 percent.

column4: RBS says did not mislead investors in $6.5 billion lawsuit defense
column5: LONDON Royal Bank of Scotland  said it and its former bosses might have made bad business decisions in the past but that did not mean they misled investors or acted illegally  as the bank defended itself against a 4 billion pound (US$6.5 billion) lawsuit from shareholders.

column4: RBS to lodge defence in 4 bln stg shareholder lawsuit

column4: Simon Property to spin off smaller malls into REIT
column5: Simon Property Group Inc   the largest owner of U.S. malls and outlet centers  will spin off its strip malls and smaller shopping centers into a publicly traded REIT to focus solely on its larger retail properties.

column4: Simon Property to spin off strip center business  smaller malls
column5: Dec 13 Simon Property Group Inc  the largest owner of U.S. malls and outlet centers  said it would spin off its strip center business and smaller enclosed malls into a publicly traded REIT through a distribution to shareholders.

column4: Beyonce surprises fans with release of album
column5: NEW YORK U.S. pop singer Beyonce surprised fans and critics with the release of her fifth solo studio album on Friday  which features 14 new songs and 17 videos and generated a frenzy on Twitter. | Video

column4: Singer Beyonce surprises fans with unheralded album release
column5: Dec 13 U.S. pop singer Beyonce trumped fans by releasing an unheralded self-titled fifth solo studio album on Friday featuring 14 new songs and 17 videos  her label Columbia Records  a division of Sony  said.

column4: U.S. top court agrees to weigh bank fraud case
column5: WASHINGTON  Dec 13 The U.S. Supreme Court on Friday agreed to decide what federal prosecutors need to prove in order for someone to be convicted of bank fraud under federal law.

column5: MADRID  Dec 13 Telecommunications group Telefonica said on Friday it was mulling legal action against Brazil's antitrust watchdog Cade  which earlier this month ruled against the Spanish firm's Brazilian strategy.

column4: Toyota to start settlement talks for acceleration cases
column5: Toyota Motor Corp will begin talks to potentially settle hundreds of lawsuits alleging that defects caused some of its vehicles to unexpectedly accelerate  according to a court filing.

column5: Dec 13 Toyota Motor Corp will begin talks to potentially settle hundreds of lawsuits alleging that defects caused some of its vehicles to unexpectedly accelerate  according to a court filing.

column4: PHILIPPINES PRESS-Toyota unit sees auto part exports hitting $1 bln next year - Star
column5: Toyota Motor Corp's Philippine unit expects its exports of auto parts next year to rise to $1 billion from this year's estimated shipments of $954 million as suppliers plan to expand production  the Philippine Star newspaper reported.

column4: Keystone XL pipeline loses support from U.S. customer
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 13 Continental Resources  one of the companies that has committed to ship crude on TransCanada Corp's proposed Keystone XL pipeline  now says the controversial pipeline is no longer needed.

column4: UPDATE 1-Twitter backtracks on block feature after users revolt
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 12 Twitter Inc was forced to nix a change to its "block" feature on Thursday after attracting a wave of protest from users who said the new policy empowered perpetrators of online abuse.

column4: Twitter users revolt over changes to abusive behavior policy
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 12 Twitter Inc  encountered a user revolt for the first time as a public company after it tweaked its "block" function on Thursday  prompting an outcry from those who said the new policy empowered perpetrators of online abuse.

column4: Pratt expects partial deal to sustain F-35 jet engines soon
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas  Dec 13 Engine maker Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp  said on Friday that it expected to sign a partial agreement before the end of the year to fund operations and maintenance of the next batch of engines it is building for the Lockheed Martin Corp  F-35 fighter jet.

column4: UPDATE 2-United Technologies gives muted view for 2014
column5: Dec 12 United Technologies Corp  the world's largest maker of elevators and air conditioners  on Thursday projected earnings to rise 7 percent to 11 percent next year  barely meeting analysts' targets  and gave a  revenue view that fell short of Wall Street expectations.

column4: U.S. judge approves retail credit card fee settlement
column5: NEW YORK A U.S. federal judge on Friday approved an estimated $5.7 billion class action settlement between merchants and Visa Inc  and MasterCard Inc  over credit card fees despite objections from thousands of retailers who complained it was inadequate.

column4: Wal-Mart names new head for India business
column5: MUMBAI  Dec 13 Wal-Mart Stores Inc  the world's largest retailer  on Friday named Krish Iyer as the new president and chief executive officer of its Indian unit  effective Jan. 20.

column4: U.S. can add Wells Fargo executive as mortgage fraud defendant
column5: NEW YORK The United States may add Wells Fargo & Co Vice President Kurt Lofrano as a defendant in its year-old lawsuit accusing the country's largest mortgage lender of fraud  a Manhattan federal judge said.
